Localisation.Text: The rats bring you down, their teeth ripping your life away.
As you are walking down a corridor a quick skittering sound alerts you to something coming your way.
You manage to bring them all down.
Suddenly a pack of large, vicious rats springs out at you.
As you wander down the alley you come across a group of men standing around, hassling a young woman.
The lady thanks you profusely before quickly hurrying off.
The men knock you unconscious. You wake up some time later, your wallet completely empty and the group gone.
As you wander down the alley you come across a group of men standing around, hassling a man.
The men knock you unconscious. You wake up some time later, your wallet completely empty and the group gone.
The man comes up to you and thanks you profusely. He introduces himself as a merchant and presses a large bag of coins into your hands, insisting you deserve it for saving him.
You go to visit the augmenter. After a short wait in a queue you are ushered into a room with various glowing gems, each labelled with the effect it'll have on you.
What would you like to buy?
"Come back again!"
"Scram then."
In the backalleys of the city many gambling rings operate. Anyone can join in, assuming that they have the cash for a buy in.
You win spectacularly! Lady Luck must be smiling on you.
You decide to try out Bleeding Cassocks. This game seems pretty complicated, but you think you can manage it.
Sadly you lose. You leave with nothing.
You lose spectacularly. Your luck must be dire.
The bouncer holds out his hand and you hand over the money.
You win the game! You make a great amount of money.
You head over to the game of Spinning Jester. After watching for a little while you think you understand the rules, and step forward to play.
You wander over to the game of Blind Man's Hand. It seems to be pure luck, but you're feeling lucky.
You approach the on of these rings, determined to make great money. A large imposing bouncer stops you at the door.
"Buy in first. What level you goin for?"
"Right this way sir." The bouncer directs you inside, handing you a chip to represent what you paid him.
VIP (250) (Not enough money)
High (150)
High (150) (Not enough money)
Normal (75)
Normal (75) (Not enough money)
Actually I think I'm in the wrong place.
Inside theres multiple games running, crowded with people with excitement lighting up their faces.
What game do you want to play?
Spinning Jester (Low risk, low reward)
Bleeding Cassocks (Medium risk, medium reward)
Blind Man's Hand (High risk, high reward)
As you wander down the alley you come across a stall set into the wall. The shady man behind it gestures you over, revealing a large collection of items.
"Find something that interests you friend? I've got great prices for those who don't ask too many questions about where the items came from."
"Nice to do business with ya. If anything happens to come into your possession that may have belonged to someone else then come see me. I'll take it off your hands."
You stumble and the guards catch you. Several hours of questioning later they release you, but not before confiscating most of your money as 'evidence'.
You manage to outrun the guards.
As you wander down the alley you come across a stall set into the wall. The shady man behind it gestures you over, revealing a large collection of items.
"Find something that interests you friend? I've got great prices for those who don't ask too many questions."
Just as you start browsing the items the clanking of boots of the ground sounds from the entrance to the alley.
"Its the fuzz! Run!"
Ruffletop flicks his hair back. "Well this will make quite the tale to the ladies. The dashing cleric taking down the terrible beast. With a little help from his sidekicks of course."
Grayheart looks at the party and nods his head, indicating to the creature. Each person nods their head in turn, including you.
Grayheart looks at you and nods his head, indicating to the creature. You nod back.
The beast is too strong, and you barely manage to get everyone out alive.
Felixa smiles at you and starts to dig around the creatures body. "The value of this thing is far more than that treasure, I'm glad you dragged me out here."
Barron also claps you on the shoulder. "Indeed, you were most spectacular."
You finally make your way to the heart of the cave. In the chamber beyond the vast tentacled mass of the loathsome beholder floats menacingly.
The beast falls, you are triumphant! Grayheart walks over and excitedly shakes your hand.
"Thank you so much friend! Without you I would never have been able to pull this off.
With that he draws his blade and charges. The battle is on!
Grayheart cuts out the core of the beast and hands it to you. "I think you've earned this."
Sadly you're too poor to afford a replacement. Hopefully your weapon lasts!
"It'd be 200 gold for a brand spanking new replacement for what you have there. What do you say?"
You enter the blacksmiths shop, having dropped off your weapon to be repaired a few days ago. It should now be ready to collect.
"A pleasure doing business with you."
"Sadly the weapon is flawed, there's only so much I could do. I'd advise you buy another."
"Your funeral."
Sure, here's the money.
No thank you, I'll stick with what I've got.
A gruff voice calls out towards you as you enter.
"Hoy! Over here! It sure took you long enough to arrive." The blacksmith says, brandishing your weapon. "Here, all complete as you ordered."
You entirely forgot to check the treasure. It's actually worthless junk! Disgusted you toss it away and leave.
You smash your way out and eagerly examine your loot.
You find a lovely pile of treasure, just waiting to be claimed. The only issue is the way out is blocked. Time to smash your way free.
There is just too much rubble to shift. You eventually give up and return to the surface.
You finally clear enough of the rubble to crawl through. Luckily the passage beyond is clear of obstructions.
The passage ahead seems to have collapsed, with pillars and boulders blocking your advance. You'll have to work hard to unblock it if you want to go on.
You smash the treasure too. Oops.
A pile of treasure sits balanced just out of reach. A bit of smashing and it can be yours!
The treasure falls straight into your hands.
You are really bad at smashing aren't you. Better luck next time.
The way ahead is entirely blocked up. Your only option is to smash on through.
You feel a bit stronger after that.
You fail the test. You won't become an alchemist this time.
You pass the test! The examiner walks over and shakes your hand.
To join you alchemists guild you have to take three examinations. The final test is to make three potions with your gathered herbs.

"Vitalis Luminaris is a curious plant that can have a variety of effects depending on how its prepared. I want you to make three potions with that buds you gathered, showing off all the three effects. Just be careful of the dangerous fumes it produces. Good luck."
"Very well done, an impressive performance! Here is your guild badge and certificate, you are now officially an alchemist."
Your persistence is rewarded as you pull the item from the mess, polishing it off.
A glint attracts your attention as you explore. Just a bit of digging and you may unearth something valuable!
You finally give up on searching for the source of the glint. It must have been a trick of the light.
You head towards the Magic University.
The city is filled with opportunities for those willing to seize them. As you are walking around you hear people talked about all sorts of things.
You head towards the Alchemists Guild
You head towards the Order of the Golden Sun
"Did you hear? The university is holding admissions for aspiring mages today."
"Wow, what a coincidence, so is the Order of the Golden Sun. They are putting the initiates through trials."
"I just remembered, the alchemists guild is currently running their entrance exams as well."
What would you like to check out?
Check out the Magic University
Check out the Magic University (Completed)
Check out the Order of the Golden Sun
Check out the Order of the Golden Sun (Completed)
Check out the Alchemists Guild
Check out the Alchemists Guild (Completed)
You come across an ancient room filled with crumbling pillars. In the far corner a pile of treasure sits balanced atop a ledge.
Each pillar falls to knock the next pillar down, all across the room. Finally the treasure falls at your feet.
The pillars collapse on top of the treasure, burying it in a huge heap of rubble.
The pillars are too damaged to climb safely, but if they are knocked down in the right way you can topple them all to get the treasure.
The way ahead is blocked by a group of monsters. Your only option is to smash on through. You draw your weapon and attack!
You stand victorious over your fallen foes. A small pile of money catches your eye to one side.
The enemies are too strong, you are forced to turn back.
The day turns into evening which turns in to night, but there are still crates left. You'll finish the work tomorrow.
Your barn is filled with old, rotting crates. They are useless for anything, but maybe you can burn them. Smash them all to pieces.
Your barn is finally clear, the old crates now firewood and stacked neatly in a corner. You go to bed pleased.
"Someone else then, how about you."
As you wander down the alley you come across a stall set into the wall. A lady dressed in gaudy clothing stands behind it gesturing to a small group of onlookers.
It's demon side up.
It's god side up!
The crowd ignore you.
"Ahh such a shame, better luck next time!"
"Step right up then, and flip this coin."
"Come on up and try your luck! For a mere 50 gold you can toss the coin of wealth. If it lands god side up, I'll give you 150 gold! If it lands demon side up you get nothing."
"We have a winner! Congratulations friend!"
You step up and flip the coin into the air. It spins multiple time and finally lands on...
"Who is brave enough to try? How about you stranger?"
I'll give it a try (50)
I'm sorry I don't have 50 gold
No thank you
Combat is an integral part of an adventurers lifestyle, so to be successful you have to be very good at it.
Sadly you still haven't mastered the art of combat. You still have much training ahead.
The training has paid off, you feel ready to fight anything now.
You've been training at the guild practise field for a while, diligently striking the training dummies.
Just ahead of you stands a lone altar. It's surface is marked by bloodstain, and dark sigils are further into its sides.
The monsters are too much and you are forced to flee.
The moment the altar is destroyed the mist vanishes. The monsters around you collapse still to the ground, drained husks of their former selves.
Around it an evil mist lurks, and within the mist move monsters, distorted and empowered by the evil energy.
Destroy the altar to stop its corruption spreading!
Your training pays off. You can channel your inner forces with much greater ease.
You see no results for your efforts.
Within your body is a seething mass of energy. With sufficient training you can channel this power to utilise powerful abilities.
You finally reach the bottom, dank dark tunnels stretching off to either side of you.

You open the gate and enter a long, steep passageway that descends into darkness. As you walk down it the slope gets steeper until you are climbing down, attempting not to fall and slide to your death.
You nerve gives out and you retreat back to the light.

You wake late at night to the acrid smell of smoke. You rush outside, ready to combat the flames, only to find that the blaze isn't on your farm at all. Instead the entire sky above the town is glowing red from a massive inferno.
You quickly dress and rush to the town.
You arrive to find the entire place in flames. Bodies are littered all over the ground, cut apart by cruel blades. A small number of goblin corpses are mingled in with the townsfolk.
You grab a fallen blade and rush into the town, trying to save anyone you can.
Alas it is too late. The town is pillaged, ravaged. The survivors pack their things and travel north, to the great city of Gladsheim.

You join them, spirits low. You cannot farm anymore, the distance to transport your goods is far too high. Instead you have to make your fortune adventuring, risking your life looting forgotten ruins in the search of treasures.
And maybe one day, you can get revenge for the atrocity.
What a shame, it was some worthless junk all along.
What a fancy gemstone you've found! That will sell very nicely.
You catch a gleam of something out of the corner of your eye. On further investigation it's coming from beneath a mound of debris.
If you can dig it out it may be worth something, so get digging!
You spot a pile of gear, lying discarded in a corner. Some of it may still be usable.
It's all rusted and useless.
You manage to salvage something usable from the pile.
As you wander down the alley you come across a stall set into the wall. A lady dressed in gaudy clothing stands behind it gesturing to a small group of onlookers.
It's a piece of paper with 'Luck' written on it!
"Someone else then, how about you."
It's a blank piece of paper.
"Ahh such a shame, better luck next time!"
The crowd ignore you.
"Step right up then, and draw from this box."
"Come on up and try your luck! Do the gods smile on you? Is lady luck your friend? It's a mere 100 gold to try it, and you can win 300!"
"We have a winner! Congratulations friend!"
You step up and reach into the box. Various papers brush your fingers and you pick out one at random...
"Who is brave enough to try? How about you stranger?"
I'll give it a try (100)
I'm sorry I don't have 100 gold
No thank you
"Nah mate I don't do discounts. It'll be 50."
"Here you go. Enjoy!"
Would you like to buy it?
"Sure mate, I can see you're a nice fella. 25, just for ya."
You wander down the alley. A man steps out of the dark and gestures to you.
"Piss off then mate."
Buy it ({Cost})
Don't buy it
I can't afford that.
"Oy mate, wanna buy somefin to get your mind extra speedy? Just 50 gold."
As you take the drug you start to feel really angry.
"How about 25?" You respond.
You wander down the alley. A man steps out of the dark and gestures to you.
Would you like to buy it?
"Piss off then mate."
"Here you go. Enjoy!"
"Nah mate I don't do discounts. It'll be 50."
"Sure mate, I can see you're a nice fella. 25, just for ya."
Buy it ({Cost})
Don't buy it
I can't afford that.
"Oy mate, wanna by somefin to get your mind extra speedy? Just 50 gold."
"How about 25?" You respond.
As you take the drug you feel quick.
Your training has left you strong and fit.
Oh no, you overdid it and injured yourself. Sadly you achieved no gains from your training.
To improve your endurance during battles on your quests you've been diligently training your body.
Regular runs, sessions with weights and healthy eating have been your life for a while now. Did it pay off?
The gods hear your prayers and the corruption is expelled from the altar. You feel a whisper in your mind, a sense of gratitude, and a surge of power.
Either your gods weren't listening, or your prayers were just too weak, but the evil emerged victorious. You slink away dejected.
An evil altar stands up ahead. You approach and kneel before it, offering up a prayer to the gods. You feel the corruption in this place try to resist you.
You find an advertisement asking for volunteers to try a new drug. You decide to try and go along. What could it hurt?
The drug seems to do nothing. The alchemist looks disappointed.
As you drink the drug it burns through your veins. You drop to your knees, a greenish tint colouring your skin, rage filling your mind. The alchemist looks pleased.
You trundle your cart of produce over to the large market and set up your stall.
You completely sell out! With pockets full of gold and an empty cart you happily return home.
Today just wasn't all that successful. Maybe tomorrow will bring better profits.
You soon get some attention, people wandering over to inspect your goods. Can you make some sales?
Play introduction?
You wake up in the morning, still groggy from sleep. Your bed is oh so very inviting.
You force yourself to get up. You really should face the day.
Are you sure you want to skip the introduction?
You roll over and go back to sleep. The day can wait.
Play Introduction
Play the introduction.
Skip introduction.
Skip Introduction
You know you should get up and begin on the days work, but maybe you could sneak in a little more sleep.
It is well know that large donations to the temple also equal large favours from the gods. You head to the cities largest temple and begin to pray (and pay) for their attention.
The gods smile on you for your donation.
The gods seem to be ignoring you, but they don't turn down your money.
You complete the chain of pass the parcel and get a neat reward.
One of the most common (and most annoying) quests for an adventurer is the fetch quest. A sequence of people get you to take a random assortment of items to one another. At least it pays well.
You forget where you are supposed to take the final item and give up.
You get thoroughly beaten up and the blacksmith retrieves his item, grumbling about needing to make adjustments.
The gear works great, and you soundly thrash your opponents. The blacksmith lets you keep the item, thanking for for trying it out.

The best way to try out new armour is in combat. The blacksmith is offering one of his latest creations to anyone who volunteers. You show up and are handed a piece of gear and told to take on the three burly men standing in the courtyard. En Garde.
Suddenly the house groans and begins to collapse. You just barely manage to escape with your life.
You hear a faint cry over the crackling of the blaze. "Please help! Anybody!"
You manage to pull the small family out from the house, moments before it collapses.
There's some people still alive in there! If you want to save them, you'll have to break them out fast.
"Thank you, thank you so much. Here, take this, as thanks for saving our lives." The woman presses a small gem into your hands, then stumbles away.
You pass the test! The alchemist places the buds within a container, and seals it with a personal stamp.
You fail the test. You won't become an alchemist this time.
To join you alchemists guild you have to take three examinations. The second is to test your skill at identifying wild herbs, to see if you can reliably source the materials you will need.
You arrive at the test site along with a group of other applicants. The alchemist in charge steps forward to greet you all.
"There you go. Take that container back to the guild and you'll be admitted to the final test. Good luck."

"Welcome aspiring alchemists. The task here is to gather the ripe buds of the Vitalis Luminaris plant. As you well know only the mature buds have alchemical properties, so check the vibrance of the plant before you bring it back. You have one hour."
As you explore a stash of treasure catches your eye. You head over to investigate it.
It wasn't treasure at all! Just worthless junk.
You rummage through the stash, finally coming away with something valuable.
You stumble across and old room, filled with locked chests.
You escape just in time, treasures in hand.
The sound of the horde gets too close and you are forced to flee.
The approaching sound of a dangerous horde of monsters forces you into frantic action.
Grab what you can and get out of here!
The creature finally falls. From beneath its loincloth rolls a large key, you take it and unlock the ancient padlock sealing the gate. You can now descend.
Before the gate to the depths stands a hulking creature wielding a pair of blades. If you want to go down you'll have to defeat it.
You barely escape with your life. You'll have to return when you are stronger.
To the side of the gate you find a large sword propped against the wall.
As you pick it up you get a strange urge to take off your pants.
You search around for any herbs you were given.
You fail to find any of the herbs you were required to.
You return the basketful of herbs to the quest giver, and walk away with a tidy reward for your efforts.
You are in and out like lightning.
At the far end of the room you can spot a treasure. Monsters line the walls to either side. You are going to have to be fast to get it out before they overwhelm you.
The monsters are too much, you are forced to flee.
You escape with armfuls of gemstones.
You flee, barely escaping with your life.
You come across a vault, filled with glimmering gemstones.
Around the vault stalk several hulking golems, their stone feet crunching through the remains of adventurers who failed to loot this place in the past.
You strength fades, the sheer numbers slowly overwhelming you. Finally you miss a block and a sword takes you in the neck, sending you tumbling down into oblivion.
You stand victorious over the bodies of the goblins, the raiding group finally defeated. The shaman's staff glimmers in the muck and you take it as spoils.
At the center of the village stands a goblin shaman, surrounded by a mound of corpses. It gestures with its hand to direct the goblins to undamaged houses, shouting in its harsh language.
This beast seems to be the leader of the group that destroyed your village. Now is the time to get your revenge. You draw your weapon and attack!
Together with the rest of the survivors you eventually head towards the nearest city, Gladsheim, to seek out a new life.
You prevail against the odds. You are a champion!
A pack of monsters surrounds another that exudes an aura of deadliness. This will be a tough fight.
You are forced to flee, they are way too strong.
As you slay the final monster a wash of strength runs through you.
You head out of the city to join the other newbies in killing the surrounding wildlife.
You delve deep into the creepy forest, looking for a clearing filled with monsters.
Where do you go to grind levels?
The monsters prove too much and you have to flee.
As you slay the final monster a wash of strength runs through you.
To the city outskirts (easy)
Deep into the forest (medium)
Deep into the forest (Locked)
Head to the volcano (Locked)
What stat do you want to improve?
What stat do you want to improve?
Health
Health
Match Damage
Match Damage
Ability Damage
Ability Damage
Power Gain
Power Gain
Regeneration
The monsters prove too much for you so you flee.
As the monsters fall you feel yourself getting stronger.
You head out of town, looking for groups of creatures you can turn into lovely experience. After a good hour of walking you stumble across a pack.
You complete the quest.
You fail to complete the quest.
The adventurers guild posts all sorts of quests. Taking them on makes face a variety of challenges.
You sit down to eat a hearty meal. Good food leads to good energy. And with good energy you can get a good adventure.
The food was delicious. You feel new energy infusing through your body.
The food was not filling enough. You still feel hungry.
You approach the swarm of monsters, carefully drawing your weapon.
The monsters lie slain at your feet. You stroll over to the water, its radiance filling you with energy and joy.
The monsters are too strong. You beat a hasty retreat.
Suddenly a twig cracks beneath your foot. The monsters whip their heads around towards you. Time to fight!
You take a deep swig from the pool, feeling the holy blessings infuse you.
You barely escape, but with great cost.
You repel the swarm.
You enter an open area and suddenly find yourself surrounded by a swarm of enemies.
You'll need to fight for your life to escape the encirclement!
You mess up and destroy the gem, leaving you with nothing but worthless dust.
You carve the gem into something beautiful.
You find a large raw gemstone on your travels, and with a bit of work you could turn it into something marvelous.
You stumble across a chest. It still seems to be locked down tight. With a bit of effort you should be able to break it open.
You finally smash to lid apart and reach inside.
With a final smash you destroy the chest. Unfortunately you also destroy all its contents.
You fail the admission and are gently escorted from the building. Better luck next time.
You arrive at the mage academy and wait in a long queue to enter the admissions exams. After a good hour of queueing you finally enter a large hall.
You pass the first round! You are ushered into a second hall packed with other hopefuls.
A panel of four instructors greet you.
"Welcome young mage hopeful. We thank you for coming to the first stage of the admissions exam. Here is a spellbook, we would like to see you use it to destroy these four wisps."
"Good luck!"
You pass the second round! You are ushered into a third hall with only a few others.
You fail the admission and are gently escorted from the building. Better luck next time.
After a long wait the second round of admissions begins. You are finally led into another room, infront of the same panel of instructors.
"Congratulations on passing the first round of the admissions. Now we'd like to see how you handle a more powerful spell."
"Please use it to destroy the wisps."
You pass and are officially granted access to the academy. From this day forward you are an official mage!
You fail at the last hurdle. Better luck next time!
After a short wait the instructors walk into the hall infront of all the remaining applicants.
"For the final challenge we want to find the best of you all."
"And to do that you are going to duel. Last remaining victors of each group are through."
"Good luck, and may the best candidate prevail!"
You can't relax enough. You don't feel focused at all.
You sit down to meditate. Clearing your mind and focusing your will is a great way to enhance your skills.
You feel focused and ready to take on anything.
You don't save him in time and the monsters finish him off.
You stumble across a merchant surrounded by monsters. He looks to be on his last legs, you'd best save him.
"Thank you so much for saving me! As a reward I was wondering if you'd like this piece of equipment I found, or this potion?"
I'll have the equipment
I'll have the potion
The monsters prove to much for you and you are forced to flee for your life.
You slay the beasts, and proceed to loot the bodies before you.
Just beyond you spot of group of giant monsters, the fallen bodies of unfortunate past adventurers littering the ground around them.
If you can defeat the monsters, that treasure will be yours.
You hand over your money to the group.
"Now give us yer money!"
"Fer bein such a good sport I'll leave yer a bit."
You wander down the alleyway. Suddenly a noise sounds behind you, you spin around only to find yourself surrounded by mean looking men.
The thieves lie dead at your feet. You take the opportunity to repossess their stolen goods.
"Hand us yer money, or I'll stick a 'ole in ya."
Fight
Hand over money
"Nice doin business with ya."
You take the creatures head as proof of your victory.
You flee with your dignity in tatters.
You get a quest to hunt and slay a named creature, a beast more formidable and ferocious than your average foe.
As you enter the room the vile sounds of tiny nails on stone and matted fur rubbing on fur asails your ears.
The rats overwhelm you and you have to flee for your life.
Finally the nest is still, rat corpses littering the room. A job well done.
In the corner, surrounded by pillars, sits a writhing nest of rats. A multitude of the foul creatures clambering over one another.
If you can destroy this nest, it will surely deal a blow to the swarm.
You finish the day with style, leaving with a tidy sum and an item you crafted yourself.
You get a job as an artificer. The master sets you to making all sorts of strange but useful equipment.
You mess up one too many times and the master kicks you out. No payment for you.
You reach a crossroads, where do you want to go next?
"None of them agreed to come? Thats unfortunate. Well looks like its just us then. Lets go."
"At least some of them are coming along. Lets go kill this boss."
You head off to meet up with Grayheart. He waves at you and runs over.
"You got everyone! Excellent, this is going to be a breeze. Lets go!"
Find Felixa the Thief
Find Barron the Guardian
Find Ruffletop the Cleric
Go take on the Boss
You head into a small village where Ruffletop apparently is.
You head towards some old ruins that Felixa is apparently in.
You head towards the forest that Barron is apparently in.
As a party you head into the lair of the beast.
The goblin village lies in ruins around you. Now they know part of the the pain you feel.
The goblin defenders are too much and you have to flee.
You see the goblins have erected a small town of tents in the cavern. The construction seems flimsy, so if you can knock them down you should be able to trap many goblins within.
You light a torch, and prepare to attack!
You visit an alchemist looking for some potions. As you enter the shop he smiles at you and gestures at the potions displayed.
"See anything you like?"
The rock is too hard, you fail to break it.
As the rock shatters you feel invigorated.
The effect of your abilities are limited by the power you can put into them. Throughout the ages the most common form of power training has been breaking boulders.
You stand triumphant over the fallen boss.
You meet up with Grayheart, but he's alone.
You just barely drag yourself and Grayheart out of there.
"Just us this time friend. Lets do this."
You fall under the onslaught, a multitude of wounds bringing you to the ground.
You awaken to the chittering cries of goblins, followed by a splintering crack as the break their way into your home.
The last goblin falls dead at your feet and you breath a sigh of relief, your muscles burning from exhaustion.
You look out the window and see a firey red glow in the distance. The village is burning!
You charge downstairs, snatching some household items along the way to help defend yourself.
You face down a small group of the greenskins as they brandish weapons and leer at you. Fight for your life!
The last rat lies broken at your feet. You take a second to check the adventurer, a glimmer from his equipment catching your eye.
As you approach the ruin you find it to be surrounded by large rats.
The rat swarm overpowers you and you fall, becoming the creatures next meal.
They are just milling around, some of them chewing on what looks to be the remains of a previous adventurer.
If you want to get inside, you are going to need to kill them.
You enter a large room. Sitting in the middle is a huge rat, wearing a glowing crown. Its eyes shine with a bestial intelligence as it stares at you.
The rat is too strong, you are forced to flee.
You slay the rat! Its enormous body collapses down, the glimmering crown rolling from its head. From within its body a powerful soul emerges and coalesces in you hands into a large crystal.
This is the rat you have been sent here to slay.
You gather the crown and a large piece of its tail as proof of your victory and leave.
You find barron in the forest, facing down a swarm of enemies.
You just about manage to drag Barron away before the monsters finish him off. He's badly injured though.
Together you defeat the enemies.
"Well met me dear fellow. Quite the fighter aren't you! Come, let us depart this place."
"Come at me beasts! I, Barron, will not let you prevail! Have at you!"
Just as you leave the city a man attracts your attention.
"Recruiting members for a raid on local boss! Need 1 attacker! Apply soon!"
You wander over to see what the fuss is about. As you approach the man smiles and waves to you.
"Hey there adventurer, interested in joining my party? You'll get an equal share of any loot we collect."
You don't see why not, so you agree to join him.

"Perfect! That means our party is full. I'm Grayheart, nice to meet you. Now we just need to gather up the other members from their own quests. We need Felixa the Thief, Barron the Guardian and Ruffletop the Cleric. Would you mind going to these locations to get them?"
You agree and head off.
You find Felixa crouched over a large treasure chest, trying to pry it open. She doesn't seem to be having much luck.
"Victory! So much gold! Here, you can have a little, for your help. Now lets go get the others."
"Dammit! Look I'm not leaving until I've gotten into this chest. You go on without me, I'll be here a while."
"Graaaa! Why doesn't the damned key work!"
She stand up and throws the key at the floor, before turning and spotting you. You introduce yourself and say that Grayheart recruited you.
"I'll come with you if we can get the treasure out of this bloody chest. Come here, help me pry it open."
The girl seems totally smitten, and after a long kiss with Ruffletop agrees on a late night rendezvous with him.
The girl doesn't seem impressed and make some excuse to leave. Ruffletop glares at you and hurries after her.
You find Ruffletop in the tavern, chatting to a young lady. He seem to be trying hard to impress her. You walk over to introduce yourself anyway. Ruffletop quickly pulls you to one side.
"Alright, lets go take down this beast, I have an appointment to attend."
"Yes yes friend, Grayheart whatever. Look, help me seduce this girl. Talk me up to her. I've been trying to get her into my bed for weeks, and I'm not leaving until I've succeeded."
With that he pulls you back over to the girl and sits you down alongside the couple.
The beast crushes you, your broken body being consumed by its foul maw.

You arrive at the crux of the ancient sewer network, a vast room filled with mold and water. As you enter the room something large moves, drawn to the sound of your feet and the flickering of your torch.

You slay the creature, overcoming your disgust at it's foul, mutated body. From within a powerful soul flows out, coalescing into a solid crystal in your hands. Someone may be able to do something with this.
You finally reach a door at the far end of the corridor, ducking away from the attacks.
One of the attacks sends you stumbling right off the edge of the bridge, and you plundge to your death far below.
You enter a room dominated by a long bridge. Skeleton mages stand on platforms all long the sides of this room. It's going to be difficult to traverse whilst dodging their attacks.
The creature collapses dead at your feet.
You come across a larger, fiercer monster. It's probably a rare creature so you should KILL IT. It may drop some nice loot.
The creature crushes you, and you limp away as fast as you can.
The treasure slips into the water and out of sight, never to be seen again.
The treasure skips neatly into your hands.
Between you and some sweet sweet treasure lies a pool of water. You are going to have to use finesse to extract the loot without losing it to the depths.
As you proceed along the corridor suddenly a sound makes you jump to one side. A large shape barely misses you as it drops from the ceiling.
The slimy creatures overwhelm you and slowly choke to death as they cover your face.
You head down the left tunnel.
You head down the right tunnel.
Just beyond the slowly dissolving remains of the slimes is a split in the corridor. There are three tunnels ahead of you.
You head down the middle tunnel.
Which tunnel would you like to take?
Left Tunnel
Left Tunnel (Explored)
Middle Tunnel
Middle Tunnel (Explored)
Right Tunnel
Right Tunnel (Explored)
You wander through the market, the crowds jolting you this way and that.
You wander over to the street vendors stall, glancing over the wide variety of equipment arrayed before you.
Suddenly a voice calls out to you. "Adventurer! Come here, my goods will surely interest you!"
"I have equipment for all occasions. What strikes your fancy?"
The vendor sat behind the table smiles at you and gestures around him.
"Welcome back friend! As you are one of my best customers, I have some more special items for you. Take a look."
You wander over to find a stall covered in all manner of equipment. The vendor sat behind the table smiles at you and gestures around him.
"Come back another time, I may have something new for sale."
"Come back another time, I may have something new for sale."
Before embarking on the quest you knelt before the altar in the great cathedral and prayed. What did you pray for?
It doesn't seem the gods were listening.
The gods granted your prayer.
Strength
Protection
Power
Sadly you don't quite have what it takes to join the order.
You arrive at the location specified to find a massive cliff before you. The knight-captain overseeing the place greets you.
"Very impressive, you have proven that you have both strength and endurance. Return to the chapterhouse and prove you have wisdom as well."
"Welcome to the second trial. Here you will demonstrate that you have the ability to continue, no matter the odds."
"Very good! You have impressed me. You pass the first round. Head to this location and introduce yourself to the knight-captain there and we will administer the next test."
Sadly you don't quite have what it takes to join the order.
You arrive at the chapterhouse of the Order of the Sun, and are greeted by an imposing man in brilliantly painted plate armour.
"Welcome young hopefuls to the Order of the Sun! Here we will test your mettle, to see if you have what it takes to join our illustrious chapter. I will administer the trial of strength."
"Come, spar with me, show me what you can do."

You arrive back at the chapterhouse. There you are greeted by the first knight, and ushered inside. He hands you a blindfold and asks you to put it on. You are then guided gently through the building.
Sadly you don't quite have what it takes to join the order.
You finally make it to the door, where the knight-captain pulls you into a giant hug.
"Welcome to the chapter! I know you will do us proud."
Eventually an unrecognised voice tells you to remove the blindfold.

You are standing on a platform, surrounded by a long drop. A series of platforms leads to a door at the other side of the room, with large gaps between. At the door the knight-captain stands, grinning.
"Your final trial is to test if you can persist and overcome dangerous situations. Do you have the wisdom to prevail? Show us!"
"Another win for Rodney!"
You wander through the brightly coloured stalls, pockets weighed down with money. On all sides people call out to you, looking to sell all sorts of wares.
"We have a new champion! Leave the arena now and rest, you've earned it."
You finally arrive in the town square. All sorts of games are being run here, but the one that grabs your attention the most is the bare handed fighting tournament in the middle.
You take your winnings and head home, humming happily to yourself.
"Any challengers!" The announcer calls out as the latest contender gets carried out of the ring. "Anyone think they have what it takes to defeat Rodney the Red, current champion of the fair!"
To one side a group of men are taking bets on the outcome of the matches. You decide you could make some good money if you win.
You put down a sum of coins and step up to the ring.
"Oh a new contender steps forth! Lets see if he can fare any better!"
The harvest is complete, and your barn is full to bursting with newly gathered crops. Just some picking, brining and preserving and you will be ready for the fair.
More crops remain to be gathered. Your work is not yet done.
Fields of crops lie waiting for you to harvest and store them, ready for sale during the next market fair.
You must be quick however, as every day that passes allows wildlife more time to ravage the ripe vegetables.
His potions finally overwhelm you and you collapse. The man walks over to you and thanks you for the match, then pours an antidote over you.
Knocked out in the first round you slink away dejected.
You enter the tournament with a feeling of confidence swelling within you. Looking around at the others in your division you feel you have a great shot at winning.
Despite all the alchemists tricks you finally beat him down. Cheers erupt all around you as the crowd rushes down to carry you aloft.
You emerge victorious from the first round and head back into the waiting area to prepare for your next match.
With the cries of adoring fans echoing in your ears you leave the arena, hands quivering with excitement. You are in the final!
The man triumphs over you, knocking you out of the tournament. You leave, but not completely empty handed. Some merchants come to you with work proposals searching nearby ruins.
Before you know it you are entering the arena again. This time the crowd is deafening. Rolling chants of your name clash against waves of of people chanting another.
Not long after you are ushered back to the arena. This time the crowd cheers out even louder, and you can hear some people shouting your name.
Despite having lost the buzz around you is incredible, with a great many people wanting to hire you to explore and loot all sorts of locations.
The cheers of the crowd washes over you as you enter the arena.
Soon after you are swamped with requests for audiences from nobles and powerful merchants alike. Your future looks golden.
Opposite you stands a man dressed in the garb of an alchemist. Strange potions are strapped all across his waist, and he peers at you through a large ornate monacle.
Opposite you a wild looking man also enters, glowering in your direction.
Opposite you a dapper looking man in a feathered hat bows theatrically to you then raises a rapier. En Garde!
The village lies in ruins, most of the population dead. The fields are ruined for miles around, burnt down or festering with dead bodies.
Night starts to fall with the lair nowhere in sight. You begin to setup camp, you'll have to continue tomorrow.
You break camp and continue following the tracks.
Finally the stench of rotting and burning flesh asails your nose. The remains of creatures are impaled on spikes around a large cave entrance. This must be the goblins lair.
In your heart seeths a murderous rage. You find the tracks of the goblin raiders and begin to follow them back to their lair.
The merchant spots you approaching and drops his bag to the ground. He turns to face you, his arms outstretched in greeting.
"Welcome adventurer to the stall of Ab-kulash, merchant extraordinaire! Take a look at my wares, I'm sure something will strike your fancy."
"Please come by again!"
The ground gives way before you can grab much and you have to jump back out of the room. The treasures drop down into the blackness below.
You stumble across an unlooted treasure room. Amidst piles of creates the inviting tops of chests peak out at you, beckoning you in.
You manage to escape with armfuls of treasure, just in before the ground collapses, taking the empty chests down into the dark.
As you enter the room however the floor creaks and groans, and a part of the far corner collapses, taking a chest with it.
You'll have to move fast if you want to salvage anything before room comes down.
You manage to return safely with your loot.
You slip and drop all the treasure into the water, nearly going under yourself. The sparkly goods disappear down into the depths. You don't risk going in after them.
You stumble across another unlooted treasure room. The room is partially flooded from some deep source below, but the chests are still visible on the other side.
It is going to take some finesse to extract them without falling into the water.
Suddenly the horde of rats bursts into the room, knocking chests everywhere. You turn to run but to no avail, the horde swarms over you and everything goes dark.
Pack full of treasures you turn and sprint away, leaving the horrifying sounds of the rat swarm behind.
You finally enter an unlooted treasure room. Rows and rows of chests are laid out, but around them swarm a multitude of rats.
As you step forward the swarm spots you and lets out a chilling cry. In the distance you can hear the sound of many scampering feet.
Quick, grab what treasure you can before the rest of the horde arrives!
You stumble across an unlooted treasure room.
You manage to escape with armfuls of treasure.
You find nothing but worthless junk.
You are struck from the platform and tumble down into the lava. You manage half a gurgling shriek before you immolate.

You enter a large cavern and are stunned by a wall of intense heat. The entire place is blazing hot, fumes burning in your lungs. A huge elemental stalks around a raised platform, the rock where it treads molten beneath its feet.
The elemental collapses, its heat finally extinguished. From its body a powerful soul emerges and coalesces into your hand as a beautiful crystal.

You enter what looks like a giant cocoon. Webs cover every surface, and in the center lurks a vast, vile creature. The beast turns to you, madness in the females eyes, and with liquid fire dripping from its toothed maw.
The vile witch falls dead, and from within her a poweful soul flows out, coalesing into a crystal in your hand.
The maw opens and spews flames all over you. Your lungs burn out long before you stop try to scream.
You quickly rush over to the village, only to find it in flames. Thick clouds of smoke boil away from the sheets of fire engulfing each house.
Suddenly the house groans and begins to collapse. You just barely manage to escape with your life.
You manage to pull the small family out from the house, moments before it collapses.
"Thank you, thank you so much. Here, take this, as thanks for saving our lives." The woman presses a small gem into your hands, then stumbles away.
You hear a faint cry over the crackling of the blaze. "Please help! Anybody!"
There's some people still alive in there! If you want to save them, you'll have to break them out fast.
You aren't strong enough to break through. You give up.
The wall collapses and the treasure within is yours for the taking.
You spot some treasure in a locked room. The back wall of the room looks flimsy though. Maybe you can make your own door.
You come across a large case on the ground, the exact shape of a weapon. The only issue is it is locked down tight. If you can break it open, you can claim the weapon inside.
The case springs open and you take your prize.
Your final blow breaks the case and the weapon together. It's useless to you now.
The creatures plunge something into your chest and your muscles seize up. They grab you and bundle you up into a cocoon of webs and string you up to the ceiling. Your conciousness fades to black.
You slay the final beast and the corridor is quiet once again.
You enter a corridor filled with huge webs. As you move along the sound of something large and fleshy being dragged along the floor startles you. Something is moving along the webs towards you.
To join you alchemists guild you have to take three examinations. The first is a written paper, to test your theoretical knowledge of a variety of alchemy related subjects.
You fail the test. You won't become an alchemist this time.
You pass the test! The examiner gives you a slip of paper with the location of the next test on it.
You are sat down in a large hall, along with many other aspiring alchemists. A stack of papers is placed in front of you, along with a quill and ink.
"This test will prove you have the knowledge foundation to succeed as an alchemist. Anything less than 90% will be considered a failure. Good luck, you may begin."
